alert.note: Alert for Ashley (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 25 at 3:40AM CST until January 25 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON TODAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Arkansas, including the following counties, Ashley and Chicot, northeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, Catahoula, Concordia, East Carroll, Franklin LA, Madison LA, Morehouse, Richland, Tensas and West Carroll, and Mississippi, including the following counties, Bolivar, Humphreys, Issaquena, Leflore, Sharkey, Sunflower and Washington. * WHEN...Until noon today. * IMPACTS...Flash flooding will likely occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. Localized more impactful flooding could occur where the heaviest rain falls, including the potential for road closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms capable of producing heavy rain will continue to move across the area through much of the morning hours. The ground is soaked from recent heavy rainfall, and this additional heavy rain will run off quickly and potentially result in flash flooding.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
